result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Anthony Nakazono was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber granted for work and treatment.

- Sign up for probation on 4/20/22 by 1:00 pm

- In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $200 DNA surcharge payable through DOC for Count 1 in case 22CF4.
- $243 Court costs payable through DOC for Count 1 in case 22CF4.

records.addlTxt: UPDATED - applied remaining $114.00 from 21CF595 to 22CF4. Clerk of court balance due $214 and payable through probation.
Moved remaining $114 from 21CF595 to 22CF4 and applied to balance still owing. E: DOC updated assessment report. sf
e: DOC
e: DOC, Atty Satorius, and ADA Smestad. c: Hudson PD and Def. email: Jail. sf
Filed by DDA Ellenwood. km
sentencing checklist. sf

10:19 AM   CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Fox, ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius   DF:  Charles Anthony Nakazono appeared. Includes 21CF595 and 22CF4. There is a resolution. Atty Satorius recites agreement. Def hopes to transfer probation to MN. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Counts 2 and 5 in 21CF595 and AMENDED counts 1, 2 and 3 (amended to disorderly conduct - 947.01(1)) in 22CF4. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Court dismisses counts 1, 3, 4, and 6 in 21CF595. Sentencing recommendations. 

Court Orders: 21CF595: (Counts 2 and 5, concurrent)
S/W - 3 years Probation with conditions: 
- 180 days condition time; 90 days STAYED and 90 days to be served within 60 days by June 17th at 5:30 pm. May be served in MN at no cost to St. Croix County. Huber is granted for work and treatment. 12 days credit for time served. 
- Court Costs: $486 ($243 each for counts 2 and 5; apply bond and balance to be pd through probation)
- DNA Sample
- DNA Surcharge totaling $400 each for counts 2 and 5 . 
- AODA within 30 Days and follow through with recommendations
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program, as requested
- Absolute sobriety
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- No Contact with J.J. or Z.E. 
- No Abusive Contact with C.C. 
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Not to possess firearms
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent and pay supervision fees
Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation

22CF4 - counts 1, 2 and 3; IMPOSED and STAYED: 
- Count 1 - 30 days STAYED. Huber is granted for work and treatment. 
- Count 2 - 60 days STAYED. Huber is granted for work and treatment.
- Count 3 - 90 days STAYED. Huber is granted for work and treatment. 
- Court Costs totaling $729 ($243 for each amended counts 1, 2, and 3)
- DNA surcharge totaling $600 ($200 for each count)
- DNA Sample   

Apply bond on file and payable through probation. 
7 days credit for time served. 

Sign up for probation by April 20th by 1:00 pm. 
Adjourned at :10:50 am. 
 
  Probation review hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Signed by DE and Atty. hml
Signed by DE and Atty. hml
for Bond Modification. Filed by Atty Satorius. to rg for EFV's review. hml
DE would like to be contacted once bond is amended to come in and sign it. arc

10:08 AM   CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad appears via zoom, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius, DF: Charles Anthony Nakazono appeared. Victim witness appears. Victim appears via zoom. Includes 21CF595 and 22CF4. Court reviews case. Atty Satorius bond argument. ADA Smestad does not agree for contact between DE and Victim. Court addresses Victim. Victim statement. Court to modify bond to NAC once verification is received DE has started programming. Clerk will mail bond once verification is received.  Adjourned 10:17 AM

Bail/bond hearing on March 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.

09:43 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad appears via zoom, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius, DF: Charles Anthony Nakazono appeared. Victim Witness appears. Victim appears. Includes 21CF595 and 22CF4. Atty Satorius notes there is negotiations in progress  whether going to trial or plea and requesting 1 more status. No motions at this time. Court sets STC. Court confirms address and phone number.  BBH: Atty Satorius requests bond modification. Atty Satoruis to provide a courtesy copy of the DV assessment to State and will not be placed into the record. Victim Statement. Court sets BBH. Adjourned 10:04AM  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Filed by ADA Smestad. km

10:10 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Michelle P Brekken, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius, DF: Charles Anthony Nakazono appeared. Victim witness appears. Victim appears. Includes 21CF595 and 22CF4. Court reviews case. Atty Satorius requests bond modifiation. Victim gives statement. ADA Brekken has no objection to amending bond to NAC. Atty Satorius gives bond argument. Court states if DE completes a DV Assessment he will consider bond modification. Court DENIES bond modification at this time. Adjourned 10:27 AM.
Filed by ADA Ellenwood. km
Scheduling Order. Signed by EFV on 1/13/2022. c: DA and Atty via e-file. km

Bail/bond hearing on January 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on March 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Includes 21CF595 and 22CF4.

10:14 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius, DF: Charles Anthony Nakazono appeared. Victim witness present. Includes 21CF595 (ARGN) and 22CF4 (PH). Court reviews case. 22CF4: S/T Officer L. Radke (Hudson PD). Direct ADA Ellenwood. Court reflects the identity of DE for purposes of today. Cross Atty Satorius.  ADA Ellenwood requests Court to take Judicial notice on bond signed on 08/09/21 with the conditions to have N/C Z.E with 21CF595.   Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Ellenwood to file Information in case 22CF4. Information will mirror complaint. 21CF595 (ARGN):  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Waives further reading. NG to all counts. Waives Speedy Trial. 22CF4 (ARGN):  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Waives further reading. NG to all counts. Waives Speedy trial.  Atty Satorius requests bond modification. Court set BBH. Court confirms address and update phone number. Victim Witness to notify Victim of request for bond modification. Victim does not have to be present. Adjourned 10:51 AM  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.
By Maria R - 22R 000263. jaf
for Release/Modification/Change in Sentence requesting lower cash bond, filed by DE. Reviewed by EFV.  gll
Pretrial Assessment Report. SEALED.  gll

ADDRESS INFO for Charles Anthony Nakazono
Current: 1790 87th Street W, Inver Grove, MN 55077 United States  (Effective: 01-05-2022)
Prior: 1706 Fairway Drive, #12, Hudson, WI 54016
Preliminary hearing on January 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.

*AMENDED*

Not to posses firearms.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least 1 time per week. I am also to be fitted with a GPS monitoring device and cannot be within 500 feet of Christany C.'s residence. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from Defendant's father's residence with law enforcement one time ONLY, as residence is within 500 feet of restriction of GPS.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jonesys Bar and Grill, Blake H., or Christany C.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Filed by Atty Satorius. km
